Detailed Description

Obsolete - the class Menu, which uses the ActionMenuAccessor, has been replaced by the classes ItemMenu and ItemTree.

Provides a menu-accessor based on actions. One action represents one menu-item, hence every menu-item can have a text, an icon and may be enabled/disabled. When triggering a menu-item, the Action representing the item will be executed.

See also:
Action

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ActionMenuAccessor::ActionMenuAccessor (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

ActionMenuAccessor::ActionMenuAccessor (  const WCHAR *  title,
INT  action_count = 4
) 
 

Parameters:
title Title which will be used for the Menu using the ActionMenuAccessor.
action_count Optional parameter which gives the ActionMenuAccessor a hint how many Actions will be added. Using this parameter reduces the number of allocations when adding Actions.

ActionMenuAccessor::~ActionMenuAccessor (   )
